result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J. Bemus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald J. Bemus is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald J. Bemus was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant shall be subject to random testing by his agent.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant shall be subject to random testing by his agent.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with the Black River Falls Theisen's or Walmart.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Comply with medications an dmental health programming.

Credit for 3 days, if revoked.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

EMP not allowed.
Concurrent with: sentence now serving.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody with Attorney Osborne.  Parties have the revocation order and warrant.  No corrections noted by either party.  12CT56.  60 days jail. (time served)  13CM70- 2 counts.  6 mo jail, concurrent.  13CM73. 2 counts.  6 mo. jail, (135 days credit on the 13 cases).  15CM111. 9 mo jail concurrent.  15CM 18- 9 mo jail.  (94 days credit 15CM111 and 15CM18) .  15CM162 9 mo. jail .    15CT44 9 mo jail.  concurrent - 111 days credit.  Defense says 227 days credit due.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Defendant exercised his right to elocution.  

Court ordered:

12CT56-    60 days jail -  Credit for time served. Concurrent.

13CM73-    6  Months jail - Credit for 135  days. Concurrent.

15CT44-      9 Months jail - Credit for 111 days. Concurrent.

from DOC
treatment information.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Stephanie Osborne. Victim notification complied with.  No restitution due.   Defendant plead guilty to Misd. Bail Jumping.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, elements and constitutional rights with the defendant.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights and entered his plea.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Misd. Bail Jumping.  State recommended 3 years probation with appropriate conditions.  Credit for 3 days, if revoked.  Not a joint recommendation. Defense recommended less probation.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.


Court ordered sentence withheld, 3 years probation.  Concurrent.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, and DNA surcharge.  No contact with Theisens or Walmart in Black River Falls, WI.  AODA.  Subject to random testing.  s/m employment.  Comply with medications and mental health programming.  Credit for 3 days, if revoked.

This bond covers 14CT117 & 15CM18:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life.  In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Not to associate with known illegal drug users.

Defendant appeared with Stephanie Osborne who appeared specially.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant has received complaint and understands charges/penalties.  Entered NGP's - pretrial and status dates set.  This case will track with 14CT117.  Bond on 14CT117 to apply to this case also.

Pre-trial conference at 02-18-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 03-09-2015 03:00 pm.
